intro: Clitandropsis papuana, commonly known as the Papuan climbing vine, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, spherical berries. Clitandropsis papuana is often found in tropical rainforests, growing as a vine along tree trunks and branches.
